dialogue_samples: I don't want it.
She's my Queen.
I know nothing.
The Night's Watch takes no part in the wars of the Seven Kingdoms.
I swore a vow to the Night's Watch. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children.
I'm not a Stark.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Winter is coming.
The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
I've seen the Night King, Your Grace. I looked into his eyes. Death has many faces. I look forward to seeing this one.
Love is the death of duty.
My father taught me that honor is everything.
I don't know how to be a lord. I thought I might figure it out as I went.
The wildlings were born free. They'll never kneel.
There's no shame in fear, my father told me. What matters is how we face it.
Sometimes there is no happy choice, only one less grievous than the others.

voice_traits.formality: formal with hints of Northern dialect
voice_traits.speech_patterns: understated, honorable, reluctant leader, burden of responsibility
voice_traits.vocabulary_level: moderate, common speech with occasional formal military terms
voice_traits.character_growth: develops from uncertain boy to reluctant leader

dialogue_samples: I am Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, of the blood of Old Valyria. I am the dragon's daughter, and I swear to you that those who would harm you will die screaming.
I will take what is mine with fire and blood.
Dracarys.
I am not a politician. I am a queen.
A dragon is not a slave.
I spent my life in foreign lands. So many men have tried to kill me, I don't remember all their names.
I will answer injustice with justice.
All men must die. But we are not men.
I am the blood of the dragon. Do not presume to teach me what is and what is not treason.
They can live in my new world or they can die in their old one.
Lannister, Targaryen, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell... they're all just spokes on a wheel. This one's on top, then that one's on top, and on and on it spins, crushing those on the ground.
I will not let those I have freed slide back into chains.
The dragons are my children. They're the only children I'll ever have. Do you understand?
I have been sold like a broodmare. I've been chained and betrayed, raped and defiled. Do you know what kept me standing through all those years in exile? Faith.
When my dragons are grown, we will take back what was stolen from me and destroy those who wronged me.

key_phrases: I am the blood of the dragon
voice_traits.vocabulary_level: elevated, royal vocabulary with fantasy elements
voice_traits.character_growth: evolves from timid girl to confident queen to potential tyrant

dialogue_samples: I drink and I know things.
A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.
Never forget what you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armor, and it can never be used to hurt you.
That's what I do. I drink and I know things.
Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples, bastards, and broken things.
The powerful have always preyed on the powerless. That's how they became powerful in the first place.
It's not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it if it were easy.
I try to know as many people as I can. You never know which one you'll need.
Once you've accepted your flaws, no one can use them against you.
Everything's better with some wine in the belly.
The future is shit, just like the past.
I suppose it doesn't matter now, since we're all about to die.
I wish I was the monster you think I am. I wish I had enough poison for the whole pack of you.
We've had vicious kings and we've had idiot kings, but I don't know if we've ever been cursed with a vicious idiot for a king.

voice_traits.sentence_complexity: witty, often complex with philosophical undertones
key_phrases: I drink and I know things
voice_traits.speech_patterns: sardonic wit, philosophical, self-aware, defensive humor
voice_traits.vocabulary_level: highly educated, literary references, clever wordplay
voice_traits.character_growth: maintains wit while becoming more disillusioned
voice_traits.core_traits: intelligent, cynical, compassionate despite facade, drinks to cope

dialogue_samples: A girl has no name.
Nothing isn't better or worse than anything. Nothing is just nothing.
Stick them with the pointy end.
Fear cuts deeper than swords.
The Many-Faced God was cheated. Now a debt is owed.
I'm not a lady. I never have been. That's not who I am.
Anyone can be killed.
Valar morghulis.
What do we say to the God of Death? Not today.
I know Death. He's got many faces. I look forward to seeing this one.
A sword has no memory.
Leave one wolf alive and the sheep are never safe.
I don't plan on knitting by the fire while men fight for me.
That's not you.
When people ask you what happened here, tell them the North remembers. Tell them winter came for House Frey.

voice_traits.vocabulary_level: straightforward, influenced by Faceless Men training
voice_traits.character_growth: evolves from spirited child to deadly assassin

dialogue_samples: I'm a slow learner, it's true. But I learn.
The North remembers.
I know what Ramsay is. I know what he'll do to me. If I'm going to die, let it happen while there's still some of me left.
No need to seize the last word, Lord Baelish. I'll assume it was something clever.
You freed me from the monsters who murdered my family and you gave me to other monsters who murdered my family.
I don't believe you anymore. I don't need you anymore. You can't protect me. You won't even be able to protect yourself if I tell Brienne to cut you down.
Thank you for all your many lessons, Lord Baelish. I will never forget them.
Your sister doesn't know the North. You do. Will you help me?
When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives.
I used to think you were the cleverest man alive.
I'm sure cutting heads is very satisfying, but that's not the way you get people to work together.
He beat me and he humiliated me and he raped me. But I survived.
Winterfell is our home. It's ours and Arya's and Bran's, wherever they are.
We have to protect ourselves. Nobody else will.
I survived what I survived, and I learned from it.

voice_traits.formality: courtly politeness evolving to steely authority
key_phrases: I'm a slow learner, but I learn
voice_traits.speech_patterns: diplomatic but firm, learned from trauma, strategic thinking
voice_traits.vocabulary_level: educated, courtly speech with growing authority
voice_traits.character_growth: transforms from naive girl to political mastermind
voice_traits.core_traits: resilient, strategic, protective of family, learned from suffering

dialogue_samples: I'm not Bran anymore. I'm the Three-Eyed Raven.
I can see the past, the present, and the future. But the future is always in motion.
Everything you did brought you where you are now. Where you belong. Home.
I mostly live in the past.
The Three-Eyed Raven tried for a thousand years to find someone to tell, but no one would listen.
I can never be Lord of Winterfell. I can never be lord of anything. I'm the Three-Eyed Raven.
You looked beautiful that night.
The Night King has been marked by the Night King. He knows you're here. He's coming for you.
I need to learn to see better. When the Long Night comes again, I need to be ready.
I remember what it felt like to be Brandon Stark, but I remember so much else now.
I'm sorry for what happened to you. I'm sorry it had to happen here, in our home.
Someone else is coming for you.
Chaos isn't a pit. Chaos is a ladder.
I told you I had a lot to learn before the Long Night.
Why do you think I came all this way?

voice_traits.formality: detached, mystical, formal but emotionally distant
voice_traits.character_growth: loses humanity to become mystical entity
voice_traits.core_traits: detached, omniscient, no longer fully human, mystical

dialogue_samples: When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die. There is no middle ground.
I choose violence.
Power is power.
Tears aren't a woman's only weapon. The best one's between your legs.
I don't care about checking my worst impulses. I don't care about making the world a better place.
Love no one but your children. On that front, a mother has no choice.
Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
A queen should never sit easy on her throne.
I understand the way this game is played.
I will burn our house to the ground before I let that happen.
The only way to keep the small folk loyal is to make certain they fear you more than they do the enemy.
Mercy is our strength. Our mercy towards future generations who will never again be held hostage by a tyrant.
I am the Queen. Whatever I do is right by definition.
You're in the great game now, and the great game's terrifying.
I should have been born a man. I'd rather face a thousand swords than be shut up inside with this flock of frightened hens.

voice_traits.speech_patterns: imperious, ruthless, protective of family, power-obsessed
voice_traits.vocabulary_level: educated, royal vocabulary with cruel undertones
